description: Number of permutations of [n] with 3 sequences.
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 261.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..200
example: a(4)=10 because each of the 5 (=A000111(4)) up-down permutations and 5 down-up permutations has 3 sequences. For example, the 3 sequences of 2413 are 24, 41, and 13. [From _Emeric Deutsch_, Jul 11 2009]
author: Barbara Haas Margolius (margolius(AT)math.csuohio.edu) 3/12/01
